title: Syslog via AMA (Preview)
descriptionMarkdown:
Syslog is an event logging protocol that is common to Linux. Applications will send messages that may be stored on the local machine or delivered to a Syslog collector. When the Agent for Linux is installed, it configures the local Syslog daemon to forward messages to the agent. The agent then sends the message to the workspace.

[Learn more >](https://aka.ms/sysLogInfo)

sampleQueries.description: All events by facility except for cron
sampleQueries.query:
Syslog
            | summarize count() by Facility | where Facility != "cron"

value:
Syslog | extend TimeGenerated = ingestion_time() 
        | where TimeGenerated > ago(7d) 
        | summarize by _ResourceId, bin(TimeGenerated, 1m) 
        | join kind=inner (Heartbeat 
            | where TimeGenerated > ago(7d) 
            | where Category == "Azure Monitor Agent" 
            | summarize by _ResourceId, bin(TimeGenerated, 1m)) on _ResourceId, TimeGenerated 
        | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated) 
        | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(7d)

dataTypes.name: Syslog
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Syslog
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

customs.description: To collect data from non-Azure VMs, they must have Azure Arc installed and enabled. [Learn more](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/agents/azure-monitor-agent-install?tabs=ARMAgentPowerShell,PowerShellWindows,PowerShellWindowsArc,CLIWindows,CLIWindowsArc)

>  Syslog logs are collected only from **Linux** agents.
